items.title: Week 1 Colts Offensive Rankings and Analysis:
items.summary: Each week during the season, I will be walking through the data from the previous Colts game and analyzing the numbers to form a sort of “what happened” narrative, as well as comparing the Colts against all other teams in the league. For a glossary of the stats listed, reference Season Stats. Thanks to Pro Football Reference, NFL.com, Football Outsiders, […]

items.title: Solak's weekly NFL thoughts and lessons: The five best QB debuts of Week 1, plus what the Giants should do
items.summary: Can Justin Fields and Aaron Rodgers sustain their great Week 1 play? Ben Solak stacks the top QB newcomers -- and begs the Giants to hold off on Jaxson Dart.

items.title: NFL execs predict the biggest award winners: Picks for MVP, best rookies, top comeback player, breakouts
items.summary: Who will win MVP? Who will be the NFL's top rookies? Who is primed for a breakout? We asked execs and scouts for their picks.

items.title: Tyler Warren makes strong first impression with Colts
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The first step was impressive. In fact, almost historic. “It was a good start,’’ Tyler Warren said of his debut as the tight end the Indianapolis Colts have been missing. Daniel Jones agreed. His first pass – the first offensive play dialed up – in Sunday’s 33-8 demolition of the Miami Dolphins was [...]

items.title: Colts Week 1 Film Breakdown
items.summary: The Colts made a statement in Week 1. Shane Steichen and Lou Anarumo put on a schematic showing in a dominating win vs. Miami. Let’s breakdown some of the best plays from the day. Every week, the Colts have plays in their gameplan designed to attack a certain scheme. But when they want to attack […]

items.title: Practice Notebook: Injury updates on CBs Charvarius Ward Sr., Jaylon Jones ahead of Colts' Week 2 game vs. Denver Broncos
items.summary: Neither Ward (concussion) nor Jones (hamstring) participated in Wednesday's practice.

items.title: 9 years into NFL career, Kenny Moore II is still building his legacy
items.summary: Kenny Moore II, as a 16-year-old, quit football. He was coaxed back a day later. Over a decade later, he's still playing, and still has plenty more to accomplish.

items.title: Colts’ Stock Up/Down: Week 1
items.summary: Stock Up Daniel Jones Who expected this sort of debut from our new quarterback Daniel “Indiana” Jones? There were some minor ramblings and expectations because he never got a decent shot in New York, and this would be by far the best supporting cast and coaching in his career, with some time under such a […]

items.title: Colts face cornerback concerns after opening win
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Breaking the NFL’s longest active non-winning streak in season openers came at a price for the Indianapolis Colts. Colts Head Coach Shane Steichen said Wednesday that starting cornerback Charvarius Ward is in the league’s concussion protocol and backup Jaylon Jones “will be out for a while’’ with a hamstring injury. Both were injured [...]

items.title: Colts notebook: Practice squad moves, Sunday ‘White Out’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts signed a pair of defensive backs to the practice squad this week. The team added cornerback Keydrain Calligan and safety Darrick Forrest. The Colts are in need of help in the secondary after Jaylon Jones suffered a hamstring injury that will likely keep him out for a few weeks. Charvarius [...]

items.title: Week 2 'White Out Game' coming to Lucas Oil Stadium
items.summary: Fans are encouraged to wear white Colts gear to the game to match the team’s on-field look and transform the stadium into a “White Out.”

items.title: 'I felt alive again': Taking a look at No. 1 pick Cam Ward's NFL debut

items.title: That was the best game the Colts have played in a really long time
items.summary: Recent times have been inconsistent at best for the Indianapolis Colts. There have been quite a few downs, but there have also been some ups in there as well. What we witnessed Sunday against the Dolphins was encouraging, exciting, and simply remarkable. Across the board, the Colts dominated, and they did it week one. That […]

items.title: Colts’ Stats of the Game: Week 1 vs. Dolphins
items.summary: Tua Tagovailoa held to a 2.7 QBR Some fans are already downplaying what the pass-defense managed to do yesterday, which is baffling to me. Mike McDaniel is a good offensive head-coach, Tua is at the very least an average quarterback, and Tyreek Hill / Jaylen Waddle form one of the most dangerous wide receiver duos […]

items.title: Colts announce new 'Fall Fest' activities at two local farms
items.summary: Fall Fests will feature full days of fun, including corn mazes, pumpkin patches, hayrides, carnival rides, pony rides together with Colts giveaways, sweepstakes and appearances from team mascot “Blue” and the Colts Cheerleaders.

items.title: Is this version of Colts QB ‘Danny Dimes’ here to stay?

Indianapolis Colts quarterback Daniel Jones, who had to listen to his fair share of naysaying (myself included!) since being newly named the starter, clearly answered the call during his debut game in Horseshoe blue. ‘Danny Dimes’ was nothing short of magnificent, completing 22 of […]

items.title: Colts beat Dolphins for first season-opening win since 2013
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The Colts honored late owner Jim Irsay the best way they could — with a win. They dominated the Miami Dolphins, 33-8, in the season-opener Sunday afternoon at Lucas Oil Stadium. The win is their first in week 1 since quarterback Andrew Luck led them to victory against the Oakland Raiders in 2013. [...]

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 422: Streak Busters! Colts Top Dolphins in Season Opener
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts put together a complete performance in Week 1 to snap their streak of futility in season openers. Standout performances from Daniel Jones, Tyler Warren and multiple defenders highlighted the 33-8 win. In this episode of the Colts Blue Zone Podcast, we look back at the game and how the team honored late [...]

items.title: Colts honor late owner with 'win for Jim' mantra, Ring of Honor induction
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Leading up to Week 1, the message around Horseshoe Headquarters was simple — win for Jim. The Colts did exactly that on Sunday afternoon with a dominant victory over the Miami Dolphins. With the roof and window open at Lucas Oil Stadium, the Colts snapped a 12-year winless streak of season-openers, and everyone felt [...]

items.title: Colts' defense makes statement in Week 1 win over Dolphins: 'New big dogs in town'
items.summary: The Colts had three sacks and two interceptions in their 33-8 win over the Dolphins on Sunday.

items.title: 'Win For Jim' mantra inspires Colts in Week 1 win: 'We're playing for a bigger purpose'
items.summary: The Colts honored late Owner and CEO Jim Irsay not just by inducting him into their Ring of Honor on Sunday, but by thumping the Miami Dolphins, 33-8, to begin the 2025 season.

items.title: How Daniel Jones, Shane Steichen and the Colts' offense threw a near-perfect game in Week 1 blowout win over Dolphins
items.summary: The Colts became the first team since 1977 to score on all seven of their possessions in their 33-8 trouncing of the Miami Dolphins on Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium.

items.title: Colts dominate Dolphins, win first season opener in 11 years
items.summary: Daniel Jones was 22-of-29 for 272 yards and a touchdown, with two rushing touchdowns of his own, in the Colts' 33-8 win.

items.title: Sideline to Sideline: Jim Irsay Memories
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - Every week Blue Zone's Chris Widlic goes sideline to sideline with the Colts trying to give fans more insight to their favorite players. With Jim Irsay going into the franchise's Ring of Honor today, Chris asks players what their favorite memory is of the team's late owner.

items.title: Keys to the Game: Colts vs. Dophins
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - The Colts are looking for their first win in week one of the NFL season since Andrew Luck led the team to victory over the Oakland Raiders in 2013. IndyStar Colts insider Joel A. Erickson gives his keys to snapping that skid in today's season opener against the Miami Dolphins.
